text: Did anyone else become really excited when a tough boss started slumping over?
author: Ragitsu

text: Definitely felt pumped up when Marcy started to slump. I hated her IceBlast!
author: Moses Isaiah B. Palces

text: Ragitsu oh yeah. After what those dragons made you do, it was more than satisfying to beat em all to a pulp.
author: Moses Isaiah B. Palces

text: @Moses Isaiah B. Palces Seeing any of the dragons finally display a sign of injury was a real treat; at that moment, you gained a second wind before doubling your efforts to bring the fight to an end.
author: Ragitsu

text: some of the bosses are just torturous

text: Adoro o senso de urgência que esse som traz, sem falar no ritmo da melodia! xD

text: Verdade, né?

text: Great Battle Song!!! I still remember this from fighting those aquatic creatures at the opening of the game on the Beach.
author: Vaseem Baig

text: This is actually the worst song from the game.  It's actually quite annoying as a boss song.  Chrono Trigger did a better job keeping the battle music more subtle.
author: Dirk Diggler

text: +Dirk Diggler i know its your taste but how can you say that? annoying? how can you say that this music is everything except annoying
author: unkindled

text: because its repetitive and grating on the ears.
author: Dirk Diggler

text: @Dirk Diggler on videogames musics tends to be repetitive
author: unkindled

text:
True. But this is especially repetitive and annoying.  Compare it to CT's battle theme which is repetitive but soothing to see what I mean.
There's just too much going on in the song.
author: Dirk Diggler

text: +Dirk Diggler ur a big big idiot..... that all i gotta say

text:
Oh I'm the idiot for analyzing things and coming to conclusions, and not you for being a fanboy. I see...
This world is fucked.

text: +Dirk Diggler You're right don't worry

text: It sounded like they went a little bit over the top on this. I don't like things overdone too much, especially on music.

text: I mean it's just an opinion. shrug Unless it was truly a fact that has actual analysis and conclusion derived from a census of people.

text: Errr, sorry, that comment is fairly old. Kind of ironic actually, I'm usually the one that calls people out for referencing Squaresoft games as Square-Enix games. xD However I do agree, SE is nothing close to the RPG king that Squaresoft was.

text:
SE PS1?

Son, you've grossly misunderstood. It's SquareSOFT not SE...they're not liked very much
